name: Lunchwalla
overview:
Who said elections were just for politicians? Lunchwalla is the social election of lunch. Let your friends, coworkers and family exercise their right to vote on where they want to go.

No more email chains, costly text messages or back-and-forth phone calls - Lunchwalla is the quickest and easiest way to get a group together. You pick the invite list and Lunchwalla provides the reviews, menus, gathers votes, helps you make reservations and reminds you about your plans. To see how easy it is, check out the video at http://blog.lunchwalla.com/.

Joining Lunchwalla is free and easy – create a profile by visiting Lunchwalla.com or through your Facebook account. Visit profiles already created at www.lunchwalla.com.

With a Lunchwalla profile, you can search for restaurants based on your area, save your favorite restaurants for quick access and start planning your next event! You can even post comments on your friends’ Lunchwalla profiles, send messages and post photos.

Lunchwalla was inspired by a 125-year-old industry. Not too long ago, a group of office executives pondered the most important business decision of everyday: What’s for lunch? They wanted to invite their friends and colleagues, so they made calls, sent texts and drafted emails in an effort to coordinate places and times. This proved to be extremely difficult. A well-traveled member of the group recalled his visits to India and the magical dabbawalla or “lunchbox men” that have been efficiently delivering countless lunches daily for over a century. With this thought, they pondered how this could be introduced into modern life across the globe and Lunchwalla was born.

Getting away from your desk for lunch is a great way to increase morale, network and boost productivity. Lunchwalla is perfect for scheduling lunch with coworkers, clients and prospects, as well as time with friends.

Lunchwalla was created with lunch in mind, but its uses go beyond just day-time eating. You can use Lunchwalla to plan the next girls’ night out, game viewing at the local pub, Friday happy hours and that much-needed Mommy time out.

Lunchwalla is founded and managed by experienced entrepreneurs: Brian Nugent, co-founder and president, and Steve Watters, chief executive officer, started Vitality Systems, Inc, an animal/veterinary pharmaceutical company, which was sold in June 2008 to Sogeval Labs.

About Lunchwalla Lunchwalla is a social platform for the everyday planning of events, such as breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinks. Putting the “social” back into social networking, Lunchwalla combines establishment reviews, menus, local coupons and reservations into one site to help you plan everyday events centered on food, drinks and good times in a fun and interactive way. Create a profile today and start getting social by planning your next outing at www.lunchwalla.com.

milestones.description: Launched official Beta Version of Site to Public!
